_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Engineered Polymer Solutions, d/b/a Valspar Coatings (Valspar) personnel in Rockford, Illinois take great pride in maintaining a safe operation for the employees, the community, and the environment.  The primary focus is to prevent accidental releases before they occur, while providing systems that minimize the size of any release that does occur and contain it in as small an area as possible.


ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:  It is Valspar's policy to operate its plants in a manner that protect its employees, the public, and the environment.  It is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws.  The Valspar Rockford, Illinois facility has a detailed, practiced Emergency Response Plan that is utilized to respond to any accidental releases.


FACILITY DESCRIPTION:  The Valspar Rockford, Illinois Facility manufactures architectural paint and coatings, and solvent-based and water-based colorants. In addition, the facility operates a warehouse for architectural and industrial aerosol coatings.  The aerosol coatings are contained in pressurized spray cans.  The spray cans utilize a flammable mixture of propane, n-butane, isobutane, and/or methyl ether as a propellant.


GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:  The Rockford, Illinois Facility has completed a detailed analysis on the process to ensure the safe use and operation of the applicable equipment.   Numerous safeguards are in place and include Operational Procedures, manual and automated control systems, safety interlocks, and other accepted good engineering and industry practices. The aerosol spray cans are stored in a designated area within the warehouse.


FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:  The Valspar Rockford, Illinois plant has never had an accident involving flammable propellants that resulted in injuries, property damage or environmental releases.


EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:  In the event of an emergency involv

ing flammable propellants, plant personnel will notify the Rockford Fire Department and rely on their expertise to handle the situation.  We have provided the fire department with our Emergency Response Plan and members of the fire department have inspected the plant.  In addition, Valspar has a contract with a qualified emergency response firm to aid in the cleanup of a release.


PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:  Valspar has an ongoing and continuing process to update and review our manufacturing process for safety considerations. Based upon this review, no changes are planned.
